Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay lets tackle this task I need to create a BPMN-like textual process model based on the five interviews provided First I should read through all the interview transcripts carefully to understand the different perspectives and the steps involved in the invoice approval process Starting with Interview 1 from Mary the Accounts Payable Clerk She describes the process starting from receiving an invoice via email The first step is checking if it has a valid PO number If it doesnt have a PO she sends it back to the supplier requesting more details If it has a PO she logs it into our accounting system After logging it she forwards it to the purchasing department to confirm that the goods or services were actually received Once she gets confirmation she matches the invoice line items against the PO in the system If everything matches she then sends it to the department manager for approval If theres a discrepancy like incorrect pricing or missing items she emails the purchasing team to clarify Sometimes if the discrepancy cant be resolved easily she has to escalate it to her supervisor Once all issues are resolved and the manager approves she schedules it for payment Thats basically the flow Interview 2 with Dan the Purchasing Officer mentions that upon receiving the invoice he checks against the PO for details like quantities prices and any delivery charges If somethings off like if we were billed for extra units we either contact the supplier directly or ask the Accounts Payable clerk to hold the invoice until the supplier sends a corrected version If everything is correct he sends a confirmation email back to Accounts Payable Sometimes if the PO number is missing he tells Mary she needs to get that information before he can proceed We never approve anything without a confirmed PO reference Once he confirms he assumes Mary or her team moves it to the manager for final approval After approval he thinks it goes to Accounts Payable for scheduling the payment run Carlos the Department Manager is usually one of the last steps Once the invoice has been matched to a PO and Dan confirms that everything is okay he gets a notification If all looks good he just hit approve in the system If he sees something suspicious he might reject it or ask Mary to hold it and investigate further Rita the Accounts Payable Supervisor handles exceptions If Mary cant match the invoice or if Purchasing has an issue she escalates it to her She tries to contact suppliers or coordinate between departments Sometimes invoices dont match any PO because they might be for services contracted informally In those cases she works with department heads to create a retrospective PO or decide if rejected After clearing exceptions the invoice goes back into normal flow Karen the Supplier Relationship Manager is involved indirectly If AP or Purchasing finds invoice doesnt match terms they loop her in She can reach out to suppliers for missing PO or revised invoice or check contract for pricing
